alert.note: Alert for Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 23 at 1:40PM MDT until October 26 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Flash freeze on roadways. Northeast winds 15 to 25 mph. Higher winds to 40 mph in channeled terrain along the Divide will cause blowing snow and visibility to less than one quarter mile at times. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches, except 8 to 11 inches in higher terrain. Locally higher amounts are possible in valleys. * WHERE...MacDonald Pass, Homestake Pass, Butte,Georgetown Lake, Highway 12 Garrison to Elliston, I-90 East Missoula to Bearmouth, Highway 83 Seeley Lake to Condon, and Highway 200 Bonner to Greenough * WHEN...From 6 PM Tuesday to noon MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Butte, Blackfoot Region; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
